intro: Diplachne scabra, commonly known as rough flatgrass, is a perennial grass species native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender,丛生 growth habit and narrow, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Diplachne scabra is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its adaptability to various environmental conditions makes it a common weed in agricultural and natural settings.
